SENT.plain: We evaluated a patient with mild intellectual disability, obesity, overgrowth, and dysmorphic features
Array comparative genomic hybridization (aCGH) analysis showed a single copy number increase of a BAC clone in the 11p15.4 region
Oligonucleotide aCGH refined the duplication to approximately 2.29â€‰ megabases (Mb) in size
Testing the parents revealed that the father, who had learning disabilities and overgrowth, also had the 11p15.4 duplication, and the mother had a normal microarray
In addition, the patient's brother and grandmother all share clinical features with the proband and tested positive for the duplication
The duplicated region (Chr11:6,934,067-9,220,605) encompasses 29 genes, including the ZNF214 gene, which has been postulated to play a role in Beckwith-Wiedemann syndrome [Alders et al., 2000]
This three-generation pedigree outlines features of a novel microduplication syndrome
